title: IPL 2023 Qualifier 1, CSK vs GT as it happened: Jadeja stars as Dhoni and Co reach another final
content:
12.00: What a night to be a CSK fan. Around a year back, the team finished the league in 9th place. Dhoni was ageing. The team didnâ€™t look strong on paper. Not sure they even had that great an auction to be honest, but here we are... Dhoni has done what Dhoni does best. Made CSK greater than the sum of their parts.That will be all for the blog. Join us in about 18 hours for LSG vs MumbaiIPL 2023, Qualifier 1: MS Dhoniâ€™s CSK book spot in final for tenth time â€“ â€˜Ridiculous success rateâ€™
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Player of the match: Ruturaj Gaikwad (Surely had to be Ravindra Jadeja?)
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    "I have 8-9 months to decide. Why take that headache now. I'll always be there for CSK, where it's playing or something outside" - #THALA #GTvCSK #WhistlePodu #Yellove ğŸ¦ğŸ’›â€” Chennai Super Kings (@ChennaiIPL) May 23, 2023



    MS Dhoni doesn't know yet if he's played his last match for CSK at Chepauk ğŸ‘€ #IPL2023 pic.twitter.com/t5lmdkoR01â€” ESPNcricinfo (@ESPNcricinfo) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Post-match moments:
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    ğ˜¿ğ™Š ğ™‰ğ™Šğ™ ğ™ˆğ™„ğ™ğ™!ğŸ¥ Join the Chennai Super Kings as they celebrate a spectacular win and become the first finalists of #TATAIPL 2023 ğŸ™Œ#TATAIPL | #Qualifier1 | #GTvCSK | @ChennaiIPL pic.twitter.com/ZLPIY2gEEuâ€” IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Here are some reactions:
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Anbuden â¡ï¸ Ahmedabad with a million whistles! ğŸ¥³#GTvCSK #WhistlePodu #Yellove ğŸ¦ğŸ’› pic.twitter.com/Tyjhxd1Nsfâ€” Chennai Super Kings (@ChennaiIPL) May 23, 2023



    CSK finish 7th in IPL 2020CSK win the IPL in 2021CSK finish ninth in IPL 2022CSK reach the finals in 2023Only twice have CSK not made the playoffs, and both times, they came back stronger than ever the following year. ğŸ«¡â€” Sarah Waris (@swaris16) May 23, 2023



    Heâ€™s playing pretty much on one leg. Ices the left knee game after game, is hardly the sprinter between the wickets weâ€™ve known him to be. Lost many a bowler to injuries. And yet manages to lead CSK to yet another IPL final. What is this MS Dhoni made of? #IPL2023 #GTvCSKâ€” S. Sudarshanan (@Sudarshanan7) May 23, 2023



    2016, 2017 - Gets suspended2018 - Champions2020 - Finish second-last2021 - Champions2022 - Finish second-last2023 - Finalists*CSK - Comeback Super Kings!â€” Manya (@CSKian716) May 23, 2023



    CSK may be 1 of the most successful franchises in IPL history BUT last season they finished 9th! 9th!Cue the Dhoni magicThis year they are the 1st team to reach the final #IPL2O23 What a leader & what an incredible franchisePlayers from CSK can only come out better playersâ€” Natalie Germanos ğŸ (@NatalieGermanos) May 23, 2023



    Ahmedabad walo â€¦.Dhoni is coming ğŸ’›ğŸ’›ğŸ’«ğŸ’« @ChennaiIPL is into their 10th #IPL Final in the history ! MSD -the greatest T20 captain ğŸ! Dhoni supremacy ğŸ’›ğŸ«¶ ! Well done #CSK @msdhoni #CSKvsGT #MSDhoniğ“ƒµ pic.twitter.com/fKFNNskbKCâ€” Reema Malhotra (@ReemaMalhotra8) May 23, 2023



    ğ—”ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜ğ—µğ—²ğ—¿ ğ—™ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—®ğ—¹ ğŸ™Œ@ChennaiIPL enter the #TATAIPL Final for a record 10th time! ğŸ¥³#TATAIPL | #Qualifier1 | #GTvCSK pic.twitter.com/f5nfAfMc7Xâ€” IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 23, 2023



    Captains making it to IPL final most times:10 times - MS DHONI5 times - Rohit Sharma2 times - Gautam Gambhir#IPLPlayOffs #IPL2023â€” Kausthub Gudipati (@kaustats) May 23, 2023



     CSK in IPL over the years 
    
       Season  League stage finish  Playoff result 
    
     IPL 2008  3rd  Lost in the final  IPL 2009  2nd  Lost in the semi-final  IPL 2010  3rd  Champions  IPL 2011  2nd out of 10  Champions  IPL 2012  4th out of 9  Lost in the final  IPL 2013  1st out of 9  Lost in the final  IPL 2014  3rd  Won in Eliminator, Lost in Qualifier 2  IPL 2015  1st  Runners-up  IPL 2016  Suspended    IPL 2017  Suspended    IPL 2018  2nd  Champions  IPL 2019  2nd  Lost in the final  IPL 2020  7th  â€“â€“  IPL 2021  2nd  Champions  IPL 2022  9th out of 10    IPL 2023  2nd out of 10  Reached final 
  

    ğ—¡ğ—²ğ˜…ğ˜ ğ——ğ—²ğ˜€ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—»: ğ—™ğ—œğ—¡ğ—”ğ—Ÿ âœˆï¸ğŸ˜‰Congratulations ğŸ¥³ to ğ—–ğ—›ğ—˜ğ—¡ğ—¡ğ—”ğ—œ ğ—¦ğ—¨ğ—£ğ—˜ğ—¥ ğ—ğ—œğ—¡ğ—šğ—¦, the first team to qualify for #TATAIPL 2023 Final ğŸ’›#Qualifier1 | #GTvCSK | @ChennaiIPL pic.twitter.com/LgtrhwjBxHâ€” IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CSK win by 15 runs: One of the things Dhoni said (after the 2021 final, if I recall) is that CSK tend to lose more finals than most. But hey, getting there 10 times in 14 attempts is just unreal consistency. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

    10 finals in 14 years. Quite something this franchise is. #CSKâ€” Sa. Gomesh | à®š. à®•à¯‹à®®à¯‡à®·à¯ (@SaGomesh) May 23, 2023



    We waited and watched for magic from his bat. But he has not been the same batsman for a while now. Few deliveries per innings this season.This was the real magic... Runs on board, hint of turn, spinners at hand, squeeze out the opposition.MS Dhoni!ğŸ’¥#IPL2023 #CSKvsGT #GTvCSKâ€” Chetan Narula (@chetannarula) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 157 after 20 overs: CSK win by 15 runsWICKET!  19.6: Mohammad Shami 5(5) ct Deepak Chahar b Matheesha Pathirana A superb running catch by Chahar in the end but has he pulled his hamstring again? Oh dear. GT 157
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 157 after 20 overs: TENTH FINAL FOR CSK! What a franchise. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    There is the win (almost). GT need 22 off 3 balls now. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 146/9 after 19 overs: The win is nearly here. Pathirana just needs to bowl a steady over. 27 to defend.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  18.3: Rashid Khan 30(16) ct Devon Conway b Tushar Deshpande And that should be that. Ian Bishop says on commentary that this is exactly the plan that Dhoni had, to pack the offside field and feed Rashid there. And Rashid hits it to deep point. GT 142/9 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 138/6 after 18 overs: Rashid Khan on strike. Still hope as long as heâ€™s there. Need 35 from 12 balls.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Senapati misfields, Dhoni asks him to stay calm and take deep breaths. A couple of balls later, Senapati gets a run-out with a direct hit. Credit to both Senapatis there.#CSKvGT #IPL2023â€” Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  17.4: Darshan Nalkande 0(1) Run Out Subhranshu Senapati (Sub) Nalkande wanted to put Rashid back on strike but is run out at the cost of it. GT 136/8 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  17.3: Vijay Shankar 14(10) ct Ruturaj Gaikwad b Matheesha Pathirana WHAT A CAtCH! STUNNER! Gaikwad runs in, dives forward and completes a fantastic catch. GT 136/7 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    WHAT A CATCH, RUTU. pic.twitter.com/DYzaXiUtdMâ€” Johns. (@CricCrazyJohns) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Pathirana holds the key, but he has gone for 2-0-23-0. Wow, GT favourites here? 39 off 18 balls. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 134/6 after 17 overs: Well, well, well. HUGE OVER! A six for Vijay, a six for Rashid and then a four for Rashid... thanks to a misfield. GT ARE BACK IN THIS!
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    722 - With a score of 42 against Chennai Super Kings,  @gujarat_titans's @ShubmanGill takes his runs tally for #IPL2023 to 722, now the outright second most by an Indian player in a single @IPL season, overtaking @RishabhPant17 (684 in 2018). Elite.#GTvCSK #TATAIPL #IPLPlayOffs pic.twitter.com/P1TVePdsXeâ€” OptaJeev (@OptaJeev) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    58 off 24 needed. Rashid and Vijay Shankar are more than capable of finishing this, you know?
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 115/6 after 16 overs: And after all that, thatâ€™s a big over for GT! A six and four for Rashid Khan. Is he about to play another blinder with the bat? 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    After all that, Pathirana is going to bowl. Did CSK just use up four-five minutes of match-time to make him eligible to bowl, with the trade-off that they will face a penalty at the end? Letâ€™s see.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    There is some mega conference in the middle with Dhoni, Pathirana and the umpires.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 102/6 after 15 overs: Theekshana finishes with 4-0-28-2, after Chahar finished with 4-0-29-2. CSK well and truly on top with Rashid and Vijay in the middle. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  14.3: Rahul Tewatia 3(5) b Maheesh Theekshana No crazy rescue act from Tewatia here as CSK celebrate. The final is in sight. GT 98/6
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 95/5 after 14 overs: The wides have been a fair few today from CSK bowlers. But the change of pace away from the body is so hard to put away. The boundaries have dried up. Seems like a good trade-off. Good over from Chahar. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #IPL2023 CSK bowlers and Chepauk doing their thing. They have GT on a hold as they lose half their side. In-form and well-settled Gill departs. GT 88/5 (13.1)CSK 172/7 (20)Live: https://t.co/qxdEGCgswM pic.twitter.com/FsNBal6S7Qâ€” The Field (@thefield_in) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  13.1: Shubman Gill 42(38) ct Devon Conway b Deepak Chahar Is that the match?! Is that the sound of CSK getting ready to play on Sunday? Gill goes for a big one against Chahar, the slower bouncer stops on him, And the catch is taken at long leg. GT 88/5
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Ravindra Jadeja: 4-0-18-2 to go with his 22 off 16 balls earlier.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  12.5: David Miller 4(6) b Ravindra Jadeja There used to be a time when Jadeja was hidden away when big-hitting left-handers were in the middle. But he is bowling here with superb control. That one turns into Miller sharply and bowled! GT 88/4 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 84/3 after 12 overs: That was a long, long over from Pathirana. On target, he wasnâ€™t easy to put away but he bowled four wide balls in that over. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    ğŸ¥ Wicket No 1ï¸âƒ£ 5ï¸âƒ£ 0ï¸âƒ£ in IPL for Ravindra Jadeja ğŸ‘ğŸ½pic.twitter.com/cJQLZWnl7Vâ€” The Field (@thefield_in) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Pathirana in a little earlier.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 74/3 after 11 overs: What an over from Jadeja.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  10.3: Dasun Shanaka 17(16) ct Maheesh Theekshana b Ravindra Jadeja Shanaka was looking to take the spinners on in the last couple of overs but two of them combine there to send him back. A reverse sweep is mistimed. GT 72/3
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
     101 needed off 10 overs.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 72/2 after 10 overs: All Sri Lankan-contest. Theekshana to Shanaka... and it is the latter who comes out on top in that over. A four and a six for Shanaka. Good over for Titans.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    If you want to know what match preparation is about, check out @irbishi pulling out the match up of Theekshana vs Shanaka.â€” Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 59/2 after 9 overs: Another over where Jadeja was troubling the batters but Gill finishes it with a superb sweep for four. At this moment, this feels a lot like a Gill vs CSK battle. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 52/2 after 8 overs: And the CSK spin-rush is on. The overs are going through in a breeze, the runs are not quite flowing. Required rate quickly above 10.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 46/2 after 7 overs: And there is huge turn for Jadeja in his first over! Wow, that wouldnâ€™t be out of place on a day-four Test pitch. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 41/2 after 6 overs: A powerplay that CSK will be happy with. Didnâ€™t let GT get away despite some good-looking boundaries. Gillâ€™s wicket is key. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  5.5: Hardik Pandya 8(7) ct Ravindra Jadeja b Maheesh Theekshana Huge wicket. Pandya tries to go aerial on the offside but is caught. GT 41/2
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 32/1 after 4 overs: Two terrific shots in that Deshpande over, Pandya with a punch through point and Gill with an elegant drive on the leg side for a four each. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Captain Pandya in at No 3.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET! Over 2.6: Wriddhiman Saha 12(11) ct Matheesha Pathirana b Deepak Chahar: A big over but it ends with a wicket. Gill with a six to start, Saha with a four through the leg side but ultimately Chahar gets the latter. Caught at long leg. GT 22/1
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    1 - @gujarat_titans have previously been set a target of 173 or lower nine times in @IPL history, failing to successfully complete the chase only once. Masters.#GTvCSK #TATAIPL #IPLPlayOffsâ€” OptaJeev (@OptaJeev) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 9/0 after 2 overs: Tushar Deshpande with an eventful over. Both Saha and Gill with mishit uppish shots that could have been on another day, but survive. Saha finishes the over with a lofted four.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    GT 3/0 after 1 over: That steady good length outside off from Deepak Chahar. Watchful from GT openers. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Impact players: Vijay Shankar in for Mohit Sharma for GT, Matheesha Pathirana in for Shivam Dube for CSK.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    ğŸš¨ğˆğŒğğ€ğ‚ğ“ ğğ‹ğ€ğ˜ğ„ğ‘ Vijay Shankar â¬…ï¸Mohit Sharma â¡ï¸#GTvCSK | #PhariAavaDe | #TATAIPL 2023 | #Qualifier1â€” Gujarat Titans (@gujarat_titans) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    All eyes on Shubman Gill: Only last week, Kohli was passing on the baton to Gill saying, â€œGo on and lead the next generation,â€ and on the rain-affected evening at M Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru both Kohli and Gill ended up scoring back-to-back centuries. It was both poetic and ironic.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

     Centuries so far in IPL 2023 
    
       Player  FinalÂ   SR  For  Vs  Venue  Date 
    
     BrookÂ   100  181.81  SRH  v KKR  Eden Gardens  14 AprÂ   V Iyer  104  203.92  KKR  v MI  Wankhede  16 Apr  Jaiswal  124  200.00  RR  v MI  Wankhede  30 Apr  Suryakumar  103  210.20  MI  GT  Wankhede  12 MayÂ   PrabhsimranÂ   103  158.46  PBKS  DC  Delhi  13 MayÂ   Gill  101  174.13  GT  SRH  Ahmedabad  15 MayÂ   Klaasen  104  203.92  SRH  RCB  Hyderabad  18 May  KohliÂ   100  158.73  RCB  SRH  Hyderabad  18 MayÂ   Green  100  212.76  MI  SRH  Wankhede  21 MayÂ   Kohli  101*  165.57  RCB  GT  Bengaluru  21 MayÂ   Gill  104*  200.00  GT  RCB  Bengaluru  21 MayÂ  
  

    https://t.co/yihjoKOwdl pic.twitter.com/8oT5d0Vh5Pâ€” Tareque Laskar (@tarequelaskar) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CSK 172/7 after 20 overs: Mohit Sharma says the pitch is a little bit sticky. And â€˜bilkul dew nahi haiâ€™ will be good news for CSK bowlers. Could be an interesting chase. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CSK 172/7 after 20 overs: Rahane, Rayudu and Jadeja (even Moeen to an extent) played decent cameos. And that is a total that appears to be a fighting one on this surface for CSK. Dew could change things... 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    ğŸ¯173ğ˜šğ˜°ğ˜­ğ˜ªğ˜¥ ğ˜´ğ˜©ğ˜°ğ˜¸ ğ˜¸ğ˜ªğ˜µğ˜© ğ˜µğ˜©ğ˜¦ ğ˜£ğ˜¢ğ˜­ğ˜­, ğ˜¯ğ˜°ğ˜¸ ğ˜ªğ˜µ'ğ˜´ ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜®ğ˜¦ ğ˜µğ˜° ğ˜¤ğ˜©ğ˜¢ğ˜´ğ˜¦ ğ˜°ğ˜¯ ğŸ‘Š#GTvCSK | #PhariAavaDe | #TATAIPL 2023 | #Qualifier1â€” Gujarat Titans (@gujarat_titans) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CSK 172/7 after 20 overs: A four for Jadeja and a massive six for Moeen in the first three balls of the over. Shami then bowls a full toss no ball but the free hit is just a single. Shami finishes the over with a superb second half, Jadeja is bowled off the last ball. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    That is some frame. ğŸ˜… pic.twitter.com/yXBvFc188nâ€” Vinayakk (@vinayakkm) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Shami to bowl the last over. Jadeja and Moeen. There is an over-rate penalty too. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET! 18.5: MS Dhoni 1(2) ct Hardik Pandya b Mohit Sharma: Pin-drop silence. Short and wide, Dhoni finds Hardik at short cover. He walks back and the crowd look on in wonderment... the last time he has batted in Chennai? CSK 155/6
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Dhoni takes strike against Mohit. Once teammates.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Thala Runs In! ğŸ¦ğŸƒ#GTvCSK #WhistlePodu ğŸ’›â€” Chennai Super Kings (@ChennaiIPL) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CSK 148/5 after 18 overs: A big over as Rashid gets taken for a six but Rayudu falls next ball. And out walks Dhoni for a minimal round of applause... (we kid, we kid). Ambati Rayudu 17(9) ct Dasun Shanaka b Rashid Khan
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CSK 137/4 after 17 overs: And the search for big hits continues. Superb over from Mohit. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Devon Conway has edged 37% of the balls he faced today, and his knock consisted of 46% of false shots both are highest for any batter who faced more than 30 balls in #IPL2023 so far. Horrible time for Conway ends at 40 off 33 balls.#GTvsCSKâ€” The CricViz Analyst (@cricvizanalyst) May 23, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CSK 131/4 after 16 overs: A successful over by Shami. Not only does he end Conwayâ€™s misery, he also concedes just six runs off it. The pressureâ€™s on CSK now.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET! Over 15.1: Devon Conway 40(34) ct Rashid Khan b Mohammad Shami And GT find a way to choke things in the middle overs again. Rahane in the previous over and a well-set Conway now. Not the most fluent knock and he is dismissed with a rather half-hearted shot caught at mid-wicket. CSK 125/4
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CSK 125/3 after 15 overs: A rather expensive over with 18 runs conceded but Nalkande also gets the important breakthrough for GT. The wickets have begun to tumble for CSK.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  Over 14.5: Ajinkya Rahane 17(10) ct Shubman Gill b Darshan Nalkande. Nalkande gets his first as Rahane tries to cut across the backward square but Gill pouches it easily. CSK 121/3 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CSK 107/2 after 14 overs: No boundaries conceded by Rashid. Rahane and Conway score eight runs off the over. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Timeout. There is a lull in the stadium, mini win for GT.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CSK 99/2 after 13 overs: The balls being dug into the pitch hard are proving tough to put away. Both Rahane and Conway not getting the timing right in that Nalkande over. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    You miss, I hit ğŸ˜Noor Ahmad gets Shivam Dube with a beauty ğŸ¯Follow the match â–¶ï¸ https://t.co/LRYaj7cLY9#TATAIPL | #Qualifier1 | #GTvCSK pic.twitter.com/OjtjAsXLXTâ€” IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 23, 2023

     WICKET! Over 11.3: Shivam Dube 1 (3) b Noor Ahmad Huge wicket, that. Dube has been often the difference between par and above par for CSK and he has been castled by Noor here early. CSK 90/2

    WICKET! Over 10.3: Ruturaj Gaikwad 60 (44) ct David Miller b Mohit Sharma Felt like something had to give. Gaikwad goes for a pick-up shot, but the bat turns in his hand and he finds the fielder at long on. CSK 87/1 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CSK 85/0 after 10 overs: A four for Conway as he slashes a wide one from Noor through third. A 9-run over, that.     CSK 76/0 after 9 overs: A day where Gaikwad can seemingly not do anything wrong, itâ€™d seem. Yet again gets an inside edge that flies close to the stump. He has had luck on his side for sure. Had hit a four earlier in the Mohit over too.

    Hardik Pandya at the toss (via IPL): We believe dew will come in later, so we want to know what exactly is the target. We were told to take it easy after getting into the top-2, but we refused to. We want to stay focused and play competitive cricket. We are a smart team, we donâ€™t play one-dimensional, we make sure to get the best out of the wicket and have adapted accordingly.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    MS Dhoni at the toss (via IPL): We would have loved to bowl first, the reason being Gujarat are an excellent chasing side. We have exploited the conditions slightly better, in a tournament like this, the boys have adapted really well. Itâ€™s important to back your strengths, the confidence level should be high. Theyâ€™ve been able to do that and thatâ€™s why we have done well. There was a lot of dew in the last game, but with the breeze around, we canâ€™t say about it tonight, but it does look dry.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Harsha Bhogle with a lovely line in the intro piece: Chennai is monochrome. Itâ€™s all yellow.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Robin Uthappa: On CSKâ€™s mantra, Shivam Dubeâ€™s resurgence, Shubman Gillâ€™s potential and more
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    So basically what happens when you join the CSK franchise is that there is a lot of clarity, they do a lot of simple things very, very well. Once a player comes into the team, the first thing that not just MS (Dhoni), but everybody in the support staff does is they have they have a conversation with the player, define the role expressively to the player. And they make them understand what their role is going to be and they keep an open line of communication with them at all times.Experienced players especially want a line of communication thatâ€™s open to the heads of the team. And they want clarity of their roles. The minute thatâ€™s given, most good players are happy, and they know how to work from there to give their best because every player wants to go out there and put his best foot forward and put up great performances for their team.And when this communication is done, and clarity of role is defined to the player, it makes it a lot more simpler. There is a sense of security within a group. You know, I think itâ€™s human nature, that when there is security, your focus is always is on performance. But when there is no security, when youâ€™re deeply insecure within a group, then your focus is always on survival. And when you work from the mode of survival, you cannot focus on performances, you will only focus on surviving within that group. When you work from a place of being very secure, you work on thriving, you work on performing and doing the best that youâ€™re capable of, I think, which is what CSK bring out of players.I think thatâ€™s one of the biggest secrets here and thatâ€™s why all the experienced players go there and start performing well.â€” via interaction facilitated by JioCinema

    Hello and welcome to our live coverage of the Indian Premier League. The first playoff match of IPL 2023 features Hardik Pandyaâ€™s Gujarat Titans and MS Dhoniâ€™s Chennai Super Kings.The defending champions Titans were the first team to qualify for the playoffs and finished the league stage with 20 points and top of the pile. They have looked like the team to beat for the second straight year.On the other side, are the comeback kings in CSK. After another poor season in 2022, they have bounced back and into the playoffs. For the 12th time in 14 years in the league. Incredible record. GT take on CSK in their own den tonight and it promises to be a cracker.
